content.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of nonrenewable energy sources that distinguishes them from renewable energy sources?

choices.label: The construction of power plants that use nonrenewable energy sources is typically more expensive than the construction of those that use renewable energy sources.
Nonrenewable energy sources are typically less harmful to wildlife and ecosystems than renewable energy sources are.
Nonrenewable energy sources typically require additional new technology in order to be used than renewable energy sources do.
Nonrenewable energy sources typically take a longer time to replenish than renewable energy sources do.

content.answer: Nonrenewable energy sources typically take a longer time to replenish than renewable energy sources do.
